meanings.definition: The condition of having four stamens arranged in two pairs of unequal length in a flower.
meanings.sent1: The didynamy of the flower's stamens made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the didynamy of the stamens to understand the flower's reproductive system.
meanings.sent3: The didynamy of the stamens caused a funny mix-up in the biology lab.
meanings.sent4: The didynamy of the stamens was like a dance of unequal partners in the flower.
meanings.sent5: The vivid didynamy of the stamens stood out in the garden.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of stamens in a flower where two pairs are of unequal length.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the didynamy of the flower's stamens caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: The botanist explained the didynamy of the stamens to the students.
meanings.sent3: The didynamy of the stamens led to a comical mix-up during the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The didynamy of the stamens was a beautiful asymmetry in the flower.
meanings.sent5: The striking didynamy of the stamens made the flower unique.
